name: abvcl
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4
body: |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(cfv(c0, c2), cr))

stmt.origin: ffvelrnda(c2, c3, c0, cr, wcel(c0, c1))
stmt.pretty: ffvelrnda(c2, c3, c0, cr, c0 ∈ c1)

body.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(cfv(c0, c2), cr))
-| wi(wcel(c0, c1), wf(c0, c3, cr))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(cfv(c0, c2), cr))
-| wi(wcel(c0, c1), wf(c0, c3, cr))

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wf(c0, c3, cr))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(cabv, c4))
-| wceq(c3, cfv(cbs, c4))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 →(c0 : c3 → ℝ))
⊣ c1 =(AbsVal ` c4)
⊣ c3 =(Base ` c4)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(cfv(c0, c2), cr))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(cabv, c4))
-| wceq(c3, cfv(cbs, c4))

comment: An absolute value is a function from the ring to the real numbers. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Sep-2014.)
